thread.title: Ambassador's CSPEN Session Empowers Educators to Apply eBook Analytics to Drive Stronger Learning Outcomes
thread.title_full: Ambassador's CSPEN Session Empowers Educators to Apply eBook Analytics to Drive Stronger Learning Outcomes

author: Kristi Emerson
title: Ambassador's CSPEN Session Empowers Educators to Apply eBook Analytics to Drive Stronger Learning Outcomes
text:
Ambassador Education Solutions , the innovator in course materials and content integration programs, has been asked to present at the Central States Private Education Network ( CSPEN ) first annual conference. Based on its successful eBook implementations at colleges and universities, Ambassador will show educators across Illinois, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, and Wisconsin how to leverage eBook usage data to further engage students and produce stronger learning outcomes. "The insights that accompany eBooks give educators greater visibility into student progress - how often students are engaging with their course materials, and to what extent they are relying on them to study," said Steven M. Blicht, COO of Ambassador. "This information is invaluable to educators, helping them understand how students learn and how course materials support student progress. eBook analytics empower institutions to proactively reach out to students, personalize the experience, and increase retention."
"The Power of eBook Analytics: Lowering Costs, Maximizing Personalization and Improving Outcomes," will do a deep dive into the data analytics that are available, as well as the ways educators can apply these analytics in order to identify and reconcile students' engagement and study habits. Attendees will explore the role of digital content and how it can be used as an alternative or supplement to required course materials.
Ambassador's experience with eBooks runs deep, having implemented comprehensive course materials programs that give students a choice between print books and eBooks, which can be accompanied by professionally produced Print-on-Demand (POD) versions too. The company's reporting capabilities enable educators to capture and assess relevant usage data so they can recognize trends, predict outcomes and support student success.
Educators will gather in Chicago September 21st - 23rd. This marks the inaugural event hosted by the CSPEN multi-state collaborative, which provides for-profit and non-profit private postsecondary institutions with access to resources and information to assist them in meeting legislative requirements, while promoting student access and completion.
About Ambassador Education Solutions
The innovator in course materials management and content integration programs since 1973, Ambassador Education Solutions engineers, develops and implements bookstore and technology solutions of all sizes. Each program is customized to meet the specific financial and operational goals of higher education institutions, as well as the academic goals of their students and faculty. Through Ambassador's advanced supply chain technology, flexible fulfillment processes, and highly available support services, ordering course materials is intuitive and delivery is automatic. Integrating with leading SIS, LMS and Digital Content Platforms, Ambassador gives students seamless access to textbooks, eBooks, custom content, supplies and more, while providing administrators with key insights and intelligence to manage, measure and improve programs and outcomes. For more information, please visit http://www.ambassadored.com .
